017package org.apache.commons.chain.generic;
018
019import java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException;
020import java.lang.reflect.Method;
021import java.util.Map;
022import java.util.WeakHashMap;
023
024import org.apache.commons.chain.Command;
025import org.apache.commons.chain.Context;
026
027/**
028 * An abstract base command which uses introspection to look up a
029 * method to execute. For use by developers who prefer to group
030 * related functionality into a single class rather than an
031 * inheritance family.
032 *
033 * @param <C> Type of the context associated with this command
034 *
035 * @since Chain 1.1
036 */
037public abstract class DispatchCommand<C extends Context> implements Command<C> {
038
039    /** The cache of methods. */
040    private Map<String, Method> methods = new WeakHashMap<>();
041
042    /** The method name. */
043    private String method = null;
044
045    /** The method key. */
046    private String methodKey = null;
047
048    /**
049     * The base implementation expects dispatch methods to take a
050     * {@code Context} as their only argument.
051     */
052    protected static final Class<?>[] DEFAULT_SIGNATURE = new Class<?>[] {Context.class};
053
054    /**
055     * Look up the method specified by either "method" or "methodKey"
056     * and invoke it, returning a boolean value as interpreted by
057     * {@code evaluateResult}.
058     *
059     * @param context The Context to be processed by this Command.
060     *
061     * @return the result of method being dispatched to.
062     *
063     * @throws IllegalStateException if neither 'method' nor 'methodKey'
064     *         properties are defined
065     * @throws Exception if any is thrown by the invocation. Note that if
066     *         invoking the method results in an InvocationTargetException,
067     *         the cause of that exception is thrown instead of the
068     *         exception itself, unless the cause is an {@code Error} or
069     *         other {@code Throwable} which is not an {@code Exception}.
070     */
071    @Override
072    public boolean execute(C context) throws Exception {
073        if (this.getMethod() == null && this.getMethodKey() == null) {
074            throw new IllegalStateException("Neither 'method' nor 'methodKey' properties are defined ");
075        }
076
077        Method methodObject = extractMethod(context);
078
079        try {
080            return evaluateResult(methodObject.invoke(this, getArguments(context)));
081        } catch (InvocationTargetException e) {
082            Throwable cause = e.getTargetException();
083            if (cause instanceof Exception) {
084                throw (Exception) cause;
085            }
086            throw e;
087        }
088    }
089
090    /**
091     * Extract the dispatch method. The base implementation uses the command's
092     * {@code method} property as the name of a method to look up, or, if that
093     * is not defined, looks up the the method name in the Context using the
094     * {@code methodKey}.
095     *
096     * @param context The Context being processed by this Command.
097     *
098     * @return The method to execute
099     *
100     * @throws NoSuchMethodException if no method can be found under the
101     *         specified name.
102     * @throws NullPointerException if no methodName cannot be determined
103     */
104    protected Method extractMethod(C context) throws NoSuchMethodException {
105        String methodName = this.getMethod();
106
107        if (methodName == null) {
108            Object methodContextObj = context.get(this.getMethodKey());
109            if (methodContextObj == null) {
110                throw new NullPointerException("No value found in context under " + this.getMethodKey());
111            }
112            methodName = methodContextObj.toString();
113        }
114
115        Method theMethod = null;
116
117        synchronized (methods) {
118            theMethod = methods.get(methodName);
119
120            if (theMethod == null) {
121                theMethod = getClass().getMethod(methodName, getSignature());
122                methods.put(methodName, theMethod);
123            }
124        }
125
126        return theMethod;
127    }
128
129    /**
130     * Evaluate the result of the method invocation as a boolean value. Base
131     * implementation expects that the invoked method returns boolean
132     * true/false, but subclasses might implement other interpretations.
133     *
134     * @param o The result of the method execution
135     *
136     * @return The evaluated result/
137     */
138    protected boolean evaluateResult(Object o) {
139        return o instanceof Boolean && ((Boolean) o).booleanValue();
140    }
141
142    /**
143     * Return a {@code Class[]} describing the expected signature of the method.
144     *
145     * @return The method signature.
146     */
147    protected Class<?>[] getSignature() {
148        return DEFAULT_SIGNATURE;
149    }
150
151    /**
152     * Get the arguments to be passed into the dispatch method.
153     * Default implementation simply returns the context which was passed in,
154     * but subclasses could use this to wrap the context in some other type, or
155     * extract key values from the context to pass in. The length and types of
156     * values returned by this must coordinate with the return value of
157     * {@code getSignature()}.
158     *
159     * @param context The Context being processed by this Command.
160     *
161     * @return The method arguments.
162     */
163    protected Object[] getArguments(C context) {
164        return new Object[] {context};
165    }
166
167    /**
168     * Return the method name.
169     *
170     * @return The method name.
171     */
172    public String getMethod() {
173        return method;
174    }
175
176    /**
177     * Return the Context key for the method name.
178     *
179     * @return The Context key for the method name.
180     */
181    public String getMethodKey() {
182        return methodKey;
183    }
184
185    /**
186     * Set the method name.
187     *
188     * @param method The method name.
189     */
190    public void setMethod(String method) {
191        this.method = method;
192    }
193
194    /**
195     * Set the Context key for the method name.
196     *
197     * @param methodKey The Context key for the method name.
198     */
199    public void setMethodKey(String methodKey) {
200        this.methodKey = methodKey;
201    }
202}
